alert.note: Alert for Animas River Basin; Four Corners, Upper Dolores River; Northwestern San Juan Mountains; Paradox Valley, Lower Dolores River; Southwest San Juan Mountains (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 02 at 7:24PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Dolores, central San Miguel, eastern Montezuma, western Montrose, south central Mesa and northwestern La Plata Counties through 800 PM MDT... At 724 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles east of Nucla to 22 miles east of Dove Creek to near Mancos. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Mancos around 730 PM MDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Durango. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 550 in Colorado near mile marker 21. U.S. Highway 491 in Colorado between mile markers 27 and 41. U.S. Highway 160 in Colorado between mile markers 36 and 85. Colorado 90 between mile markers 20 and 33. Colorado 140 between mile markers 16 and 23. Colorado 141 between mile markers 23 and 79. Colorado 145 between mile markers 1 and 44, and between mile markers 89 and 116. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Animas River Basin; Four Corners, Upper Dolores River; Northwestern San Juan Mountains; Paradox Valley, Lower Dolores River; Southwest San Juan Mountains
